reviewText:
I'm honestly not sure whether I recommend or don't recommend this game. I guess I'll find out when I finish writing the review. Devil's share is a game that would have thrived on places like Newgrounds or Kongregate. Its got it all. FPS action, Cool graphics, and good story telling... IF IT WAS A NEWGROUNDS GAME. I honestly don't know how games like this get passed through Greenlight. Do people just pass them to see them get funny Lets Plays? Or do some gamers have a craving for uninspired flops? Either way, I despise, yet thank those people. Devils Share is an attempt at creating horror FPS game where the point is to get to the end of the Road(literally, the game walking along the road until you get to the end).

Story: NONE!

Gameplay:

The Goal of this game is to go from area to area finding stuff to get to other areas. This gets Extremely tedious because all the game tells you to do is:

1: Go get the keys
2: Open the locked door
3: Go get that new gun
4: Go to the next area

Repeat that 5 more times, and you win.
Sounds Easy right? WRONG. There are these weird Demon things chasing you around that sneak behind you and attack you. They aren't scary but VERY FRUSTRATING. As far as I've seen, there is no way to regenerate your health. No health packs, no bandages, no natural regen, nothing. You start at 200% health at the beginning and each time you get damaged it takes away 10% health(Why start with 200%? Just start at 100% and take 5% damage instead. It makes more sense). Not to bad right? Well this wouldn't be if it werent for the fact that they Constantly Spawn and they can trap you and do constant damage. And death puts you back to the beginning. It doesn't remove your quest progress, but it makes it so you have to backtrack all the way back where you were, and by then you've taken so much damage you are at 10% health. As I mentioned before there are guns that can kill the demons, If you have ammo for that gun, you can easily fight off the demons with one shot per demon. However, there is almost NO AMMO ANYWHERE. But, if you don't have any ammo its okay, because you can beat the demons with your flashlight, if you could actually FIND YOUR FLASHLIGHT IN YOUR INVENTORY. The wonky control system makes it so E switches weapons. Lets say you are out of ammo, and have to get your flashlight to fight the demons. You try the scroll wheel like in other FPS games. Nothing. Okay, you try the 1,2,3,4,etc buttons. Nothing. So you quit the games and have to look at the main menu that has all the controls on it. Time to get back to where you were. Still out of ammo, so you press E a bunch of times and you accidentally pass the flashlight. You now have to go back around again, while the demons are still hurting you, and when you find the flashlight, you die. And you keep the same ammount of ammo when you die, so there are 50 demons around you and you have nothing but your flashlight to beat them with. And this is about where I quit. I'm done.

However, for 25 cents, its worth it. Even though with all the flaws this game has, it is pretty funny to play, and its 25 cents. You could probably scrap up the money for this by selling a few trading cards, so you could get it for free. I sent this to a few friends and their reactions are pretty funny. So do I recommend this as a game? NO. Do I recommend this as a something to laugh at? Absolutely.

reviewText:
I am sorry, but I cannot recommend this game.  Overall, aesthetically the game looks nice. The weapons feel nice and are responsive however, the gameplay itself really trumps the good qualities this game seems to offer.  First and foremost are the recognizable sudden FPS drops experienced during gameplay especially when looking towards the center of the map.  Also, the melee attack range for the enemies are way off due to the fact that they can hit you far in adavnce before you can even use your melee attack on them, and even notably worse is the fact the AI enemies can hit you with thier excessively long reach attack through walls and doors.  Also, the enemies can seemingly walk right through doors and walls.  And not to mention the enemies spawn out of nowhere behind the player and make no sound whatsoever to alert their presence to you.  All of the aformentioned issues with the enemy AI makes any chance of meleeing them useless.  Another issue to mention is the interaction system for opening drawers and obtaining items in them seems to be glitched.  However these are just a few of the issues I have experienced with the game, below is my rating for this game:

Pros:
*Very nice and immersive atmosphere.

*Good graphics and nice lighting effects.

*Responsive weapons.

*Good story premise overall (despite it being simple and quick)

Cons:
-AI have an absurdly long attack range which makes melee with them useless as they will
always hit you first, plus each hit takes away 10 damage from your health.

-AI spawns pretty much everywhere all the time seemingly and can glitch through objects.
-FPS drops suddenly at times.

-Faulty opening system for drawers/cabinets makes them hard to open sometimes and items are
often glitched inside the said drawers/cabinets.

-Somewhat confusing object completion list system at times.

-If you are not practically speedrunning through the entire game you most likely will make
it out with 70% or less health at best, so there is little room for exploration without
being mobbed by randomly spawning, silent, absurdly long area of attack, wall glitching
enemies.  Which all these factors leave for little to no exploration or immersion into the
game..even if the game itself is short.

-Weapon hit-detection system can be dodgy at times

-Invisible brushes block weapons fire on certain parts in the map

Overall synopsis:

This game has potential, but with the certain current issues, with the most obvious being
the faulty AI attack system and random spawns all around you this game in my opinion lacks
the basics for being decent even for independent developer standards.

rating breakdown:

-4 very poor all-around AI enemy aspects (this includes their spawning and attack range as
well as all afromentioned issues in regards to the disadvantges their attack range and
silent random spawning has)

-1 glitchy opening cabinent/drawer mechanics making some main story items difficult to
aquire

-0.5 invisible brushes blocking bullets and sometimes confusing/misleading objectives list system

-2 AI issues mentioned earlier making exploration, further immersion, and melee nearly
impossible or very difficult

(rating score: 10 - 7.5 = 2.5)

2.5/10 overall rating for this game (The AI and spawning issues are what really drags this
game down in my opinion above all else).

reviewText:
One of the best games on the market for less than a quarter.

In this riveting series, you must stave off hordes of ghoul-like creatures in the middle of the night. Even though it was pitch black, you have to find a flashlight in the pure darkness! Ironic! I LOVE it!

On top of that, they added a horror type game with a very neat action scenario, letting you shoot and such even though it's a horror game! Innovative!

In this game you will find:

- Extremely well done AI
- Perfectly textured guns, walls, floors, etc.
- Brilliantly innovative weapons, tools, and other such things
- An amazing storyline with a must-see backstory
- Plenty of characters with a well-developed bio and characteristics!
- A certain urge that always makes you want to come back!!!

However, with every absolutely AMAZING game, comes a few cons!

- Slight bugs while downloading, though I found it pretty easy to fix
- A bit dark with playing fullscreen mode, easily changed by making the screen big!
- Slightly Addictive
- Easily obbsessive
- Amazing game!!!

9.3/10, I would definitely recommend this game to anyone looking for an action/horror type scenario game. I find that the creators really spent a lot of work on this, and deserves every penny I used to buy this game! Please give it a try! If you get past the first 2 minutes, you will LOVE this game!!!
